entry.title: Integrate VisitedLinkDatabase into HistoryDatabase behind flag.
entry.content:
This CL alters the HistoryDatabase to inherit from the VisitedLinkDatabase. We update functions that add to or delete from the HistoryDatabase to ensure that the VisitedLinkDatabase is also altered. Functions that add to the VisitedLinkDatabase are currently behind a feature flag (kPopulateVisitedLinkDatabase) that is disabled by default.



The VisitedLinkDatabase has a one-to-many relationship with the VisitDatabase, and to preserve deletion, a new column storing `visited_link_id` was added to the VisitDatabase. Now, when a VisitRow is deleted, the corresponding VisitedLinkRow's `visit_count` is decreased. When the `visit_count` reaches 0, we delete the row from VisitedLinkDatabase.



The first CL in this series can be found here: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4711646



The public explainer can be found here: https://github.com/kyraseevers/Partitioning-visited-links-history



Fixed: 1475648

Change-Id: Ia782e23aed00e0c77a9e5b7b4f358a0c6cd87d13

entry.title: Allow lifecycle updates in documents without body
entry.content:
We block visual updates before we have a body element, and avoid

scheduling visual updates when marking elements style-dirty, needing

slot re-assignments, etc. The problem with that is that the dirtiness

must be consistent with the lifecycle state. It must be

kVisualUpdatePending if anything is dirty, otherwise check failures

will be triggered.



In particular, scheduling a visual update and a lifecycle state rewind

does not happen if the body element has been removed. This caused an

inconsistency check failure when view transition lifecycle update

marked style dirty during the lifecycle update. That is what happens

in the clusterfuzz issue in the Bug below.



Instead, allow the lifecycle state to be rewinded even if we don't

schedule a visual update if we are still parsing and haven't seen

body.



The demo below reproduces the problem where disallowing updating the

lifecycle state makes us miss a rendering update. This repros in

content_shell from file, but not from a web server, so I have a hard

time turning this into a wpt, so added a simple unit test instead:



















Bug: 1473823

Change-Id: I20fb97ba98b0e051ed9349d4ef053cf3d7c3ed12

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4831817

Commit-Queue: Rune Lillesveen

Reviewed-by: Stefan Zager

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1191461}

entry.title: [Extensions] Convert webstorePrivate schema to use returns_async format
entry.content:
Note: getReferrerChain and beginInstallWithManifest3 both use

ErrorWithArguments in their API implementations, which when used with

promise based calls will only give the error and not the result.



For getReferrerChain that is fine as it just returns an empty referrer

chain on error, so the caller can handle that themselves if they want to

use a promise based call and the promise is rejected.



The beginInstallWithManifest3 case is more complicated and a comment has

been added explaining what changes would need to be made on the consumer

of the API to better support promises there (by getting rid of the error

entirely and just using the result code).



Bug: 328932

Change-Id: I26bc874d282743bc008122fc973b9e310d731ff0

entry.title: [iOS] CBDCoordinator requests its owner to stop it and destruct itself
entry.content:
Following this cl: crrev.com/c/4729590



Note that:

* clearBrowsingDataTableViewControllerWantsDismissal is called when

user press "Done" button on the right of navigation bar

* clearBrowsingDataTableViewControllerWasRemoved is called when user

swipe down the HistoryCBD page.

* Both of the above actions only want to dismiss HistoryCBD page and

do not want to dismiss History, so should not call

`closeHistoryWithCompletion` which results close history page.

* But now, if user pull down to close the HistoryCBD page, it will

cause History page close too.



Finally, HistoryCoordinator need to destruct its owned

HistoryCBDCoordinator when HistoryCBDCoordinator stop.



Bug: 1475103

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2:V4L2StatefulVD: fix lock up path in resolution change
entry.content:
ToT has a potential lock up which is made evident by running the

FlushAtEndOfStream_MultipleConcurrentDecodes test case with the

test-25fps_basemain.h264 bitstream, which changes resolution (and

profileFTR) mid stream.



The problem situation is:

- A resolution-change DecoderBuffer is sent to Decode(), and it fills

the last slot of the |OUTPUT_queue_|. As soon as it's put in the queue,

its associated DecodeCB is Run().

- The test logic calls Decode() as soon as the resolution-change

DecodeCB is Run() (from TryAndEnqueueOUTPUTQueueBuffers()), but since

the |OUTPUT_queue_| is full, this Decode()'s DecodeCB is not Run();

the test logic in v_d_a_test decides to wait and not try to Decode()

anything else (v_d_a_tests has at most one decode operation in flight

in this particular test).

- The driver processes the resolution change, flushing the queued

|CAPTURE_queue_| buffers first, then notifying its |client_|. At

this point the |CAPTURE_queue_| has no more decoded pictures.

- The resolution change logic progresses via ApplyResolutionChange()

and InitializeCAPTUREQueue() -- but there's no more calls to

TryAndEnqueueOUTPUTQueueBuffers() in this path!

- So the driver has nothing to decode, and the v_d_a_test logic

won't try to call Decode().



I believe this happens in that particular test case because things

are slightly slower (on the CPU side) with the multiple concurrent

decoders. Good test!



The solution is to call TryAndEnqueueOUTPUTQueueBuffers() right after

the resolution change logic has finished with InitializeCAPTUREQueue().



This CL also moves the call to DrainOUTPUTQueue() from Decode() to

right before TryAndEnqueueOUTPUTQueueBuffers() tries to get a free

slot in |OUTPUT_queue_|. This might not be needed for this fix but

seems like a good simplification of the code, and would apply to

both callsites (Decode() and right after the |CAPTURE_queue_|

reconfiguration.



Bug: b:279980150, b:298457177

Change-Id: I39cf266078b8e121290d08b3380f3a4c42fea465

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4834815

Reviewed-by: Hang Nguyen

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1191429}

entry.title: [Linux] Set a pref when about to load GSSAPI libraries in net service
entry.content:
This overrides the net::HttpAuthPreferences::AllowGssapiLibraryLoad()

used by NetworkContext to notify the SystemNetworkContextManager

(via mojo::Remote owned by the NetworkService) that GSSAPI libraries

are about to be loaded because HTTP Auth negotiate headers were

received. The SystemNetworkContextManager will set a pref when this

occurs.



This pref will be used in a future CL to start the network service

unsandboxed on Linux as a signal that the user probably wants kerberos.

The future CL will also restart the network service unsandboxed

when AllowGssapiLibraryLoad() is first called.



Change-Id: I3cad8ea8fd16fdd2fa7d3b04583bf8837652b648

entry.title: [Tab Groups] Remove EmptyTabModelFilter
entry.content:
Now that M117 is branched and TabGroupsContinuationAndroid is the

default everywhere the old flags for the initial development of the Grid

Tab Switcher can finally be cleaned up.



This is the eighth step which removes the EmptyTabModelFilter. This

class was used to stub TabModelFilter if TabGroupModelFilter was unused.

EmptyTabModelFilter was unused outside of tests, but some parts of the

codebase still referenced it. Particularly for checks of TabGroupModelFilter vs EmptyTabModelFilter using instanceof. This CL

removes most of these checks (except where null is possible for CCT) or

downgrades them to asserts.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Remove TabGroup related histograms that were useful for launch metrics and debugging, but had less long term value.

entry.title: Extend the total passwords count metric.
entry.content:
Today we record either:

1) PasswordManager.AccountStore.TotalAccountsHiRes3.ByType.Overall.WithCustomPassphrase

2) PasswordManager.AccountStore.TotalAccountsHiRes3.ByType.Overall.WithoutCustomPassphrase



In practice [1] is almost useless and everyone wants to know how many

passwords are in the store. For that we introduce

PasswordManager.AccountStore.TotalAccountsHiRes3.ByType.Overall with the

same counter internally.



Bug: 1259121

entry.title: cc: set is_fast_rounded_corner to draw properties of a RenderSurface
entry.content:
There are cases when SurfaceAggregator can merge render passes and

avoid unnecessary draws. This is very important for LaCros, which

does delegation of root render passes' quads.



It was figured out that whenever an effect node had rounded corners

and the |is_fast_rounded_corners| set, the shared quad state that

was created further for this render surface didn't have the fast

rounded corners bit set. The reason for that was a missing member

in draw properties for render surface that could be used when

a shared quad state was created. It wasn't a problem for other

layers that were not for render surfaces.

entry.title: Speculative fix for potential UAF in overlay_window_views .
entry.content:
It looks like the WindowAndroid has been destroyed before the

overlay window is destroyed in some cases. It's not clear what's

going on, but there is at least one path where the overlay window

would be unsubscribed from WindowAndroid callbacks without realizing

it. In that case, we might try to unregister later.



I wasn't able to repro this path locally, unfortunately.



Further, it might be the case that we should initiate cleanup of

the overlay window in this case, but this CL doesn't go that far.

If the crashes subside, then it might be worth more effort to

figure out what's getting into this state and what the appropriate

response is. As it is, it's all speculation, so simpler is better.

entry.title: Handle kHiddenButPainting when sending page visibility in WebViewImpl
entry.content:
WebViewImpl is currently ignoring transitions to kHiddenButPainting,

which can cause a page that's driving pip content to throttle itself

and stop presenting video frames.



This CL dispatches visibility transitions between `kHidden` and

`kHiddenButPainting`. It also prevents the page scheduler from

throttling `kHiddenButPainting` pages, so that they can continue to

paint on timers.

entry.title: [iOS] Fixed BrowserStateInfoCache Update Error
entry.content:
If a user is signed-in but not synced, and then the user closes and

relaunches Chrome, the BrowserStateInfoCache will be empty, which is

signifies that there is no signed-in user. As a result, signed-in but

not synced users will not receive their push notifications.



On investigation, it was discovered that on the creation of the

ChromeBrowserStateManager, the BrowserStateInfoCache's value is set to

the `PrimaryAccountInfo` object stored at the Sync consent level.

Thus, signed-in/unsynced accounts are not represented as signed in

users.

entry.title: Create new HeuristicSource enum
entry.content:
Add new enum to describe all Heuristic sources. These sources will

either be all sources available in PatternSource + machine learning

source. This will be useful for integrating the ML model field

type prediction and using it as a heuristic_type.



- Right now, local heuristics = regex. Which regexes is used is

described by the PatternSource, and AutofillField::heuristic_type() is

parameterized by it.



- As of the regex project, local heuristics = regex or ML. So at

AutofillField level, we need a new context (the HeuristicSource).

At parsing level, which only cares about regex, the PatternSource

remains used.

entry.title: [ios] Tighten the criteria for showing the 2nd step of history IPH.
entry.content:
Only show the 2nd step when the 1st step is acted on - meaning the

user taps on the view the IPH is anchored to at the 1st step. Add

plumbing to let the callsite know about the user actions from the

dismiss callbacks.



Add mechanism to detect the tap on the anchor view. Before it was

treated the same as tapping ANYWHERE outside the IPH on the screen.

entry.title: Revert "iwa: Gracefully fail requests if the `WebContents` no longer exists"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 323c0a0673cf11f4abac2c9d6fc63804a8be052b.



Reason for revert: NoCrashIfBrowserIsClosed failed on

linux-ubsan-vptr.

first failed:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-ubsan-vptr/25374/overview



Original change's description:

> iwa: Gracefully fail requests if the `WebContents` no longer exists

>

> In certain edge cases, such when the browser window is closed while a

> request to an IWA is ongoing, it might not be possible to retrieve a

> `WebContents` from the frame tree node id. We use the `WebContents` to

> check for pending install info of an IWA. This CL fixes this by failing

> with `net::ERR_FAILED` instead of crashing if the `WebContents` cannot

> be retrieved.

>

> Bug: 1477761, 1382078, b:298618746

> Change-Id: Ib983d5da50b5bd6259f8d1ef3ae1e57833a00bc3

entry.title: interactive_ui_tests: use temporary ui::ResourceBundle for screen creation
entry.content:
At least on Linux X11, views::test::TestDesktopScreenOzone::Create() may

try to retrieve a localized string for "Built-in display" after [1].

But screen creation happens early for interactive UI tests since [2], at

least before ChromeFeatureListCreator::ConvertFlagsToSwitches() which

assumes ui::ResourceBundle is not initialized. This is causing the crash

below for all interactive UI tests on Linux X11, which this CL fixes by

temporarily initializing ui::ResourceBundle during screen creation.

See crbug.com/1457129 for details.



[24841:24841:FATAL:resource_bundle.cc(357)] Check failed: g_shared_instance_ != nullptr.

#0 0x5585747ceee2 base::debug::CollectStackTrace()

#1 0x5585747b6213 base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace()

#2 0x5585746ab79d logging::LogMessage::~LogMessage()

#3 0x5585746ac2ee logging::LogMessage::~LogMessage()

#4 0x558574692437 logging::CheckError::~CheckError()

#5 0x558574bd6075 ui::ResourceBundle::GetSharedInstance()

#6 0x558574bc0a18 l10n_util::GetStringUTF8()

#7 0x5585758fddc1 ui::BuildDisplaysFromXRandRInfo()

#8 0x5585758fb539 ui::XDisplayManager::FetchDisplayList()

#9 0x5585758fb449 ui::XDisplayManager::Init()

#10 0x55856dd0e34c ui::X11ScreenOzone::Init()

#11 0x55856d09ed3d views::test::TestDesktopScreenOzone::Create()

#12 0x558572c7ec70 InProcessBrowserTest::SetScreenInstance()

#13 0x558572c7e44f InProcessBrowserTest::SetUp()

#14 0x55856d24c5f2 testing::Test::Run()

#15 0x55856d24d865 testing::TestInfo::Run()

#16 0x55856d24e337 testing::TestSuite::Run()

#17 0x55856d25cf07 testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests()

#18 0x55856d25c9ff testing::UnitTest::Run()

#19 0x5585746730ec base::TestSuite::Run()

#20 0x558572c5eddb ChromeTestSuiteRunner::RunTestSuiteInternal()

#21 0x55856cc79be4 InteractiveUITestSuiteRunner::RunTestSuite()

#22 0x558572c5f069 ChromeTestLauncherDelegate::RunTestSuite()

#23 0x558573d7b9ab content::LaunchTestsInternal()

#24 0x558572c5f325 LaunchChromeTests()



Bug: 1457129



[1] crrev.com/1010705

[2] crrev.com/1011300

entry.title: [ios] Handle Incomplete Magic Stack Module Insertion Logic
entry.content:
In situations where the Magic Stack has already been initially created and a module needs to be added, modules ranked in front may not have

been added to the Magic Stack yet (more possible with dynamic

Segmentation ranking). It is not enough to map the literal index rank

of a module to the index it should be inserted into the Magic Stack.

Instead, it should use relative rank position to whatever module is already in the Magic Stack.



Change-Id: I9a28b4626eb4e77ad41287c2dacb976ed87c3ba0

entry.title: [FPS] Use NetLog API unconditionally and more idiomatically
entry.content:
I took a look at the events in the netlog viewer (after finding

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/net/docs/crash-course-in-net-internals.md),

and learned there were better APIs for handling begin/end parts of a

single event. It also made it clear that the FPS metadata event didn't

need to include the request URL, since that's already recorded by the

parent URL_REQUEST_START_JOB event.



This CL also modifies the timing of the events so that they include

entry.title: Consistently ClearPreviewedForm() before all filling operations.
entry.content:
Right now, ClearPreviewedForm() is only called before autofilling a

fields, not before autocompleting a field. This way, AutofillAgent::

previewed_elements_ is not reset in the autocomplete case. Since the

popup clears the form when it gets closed, slightly after filling

happened, this causes the filled field's AutofillState to get reset.

That makes the field lose its color, causing crbug.com/1478092.



This only started manifesting as a bug when crrev.com/c/4670896 landed

recently. Ultimately, the behavior can be considered buggy even before

the CL, since the agent retained no longer previewed elements in its

previewed_elements_ state.



This CL fixes this problem by calling ClearPreviewedForm() in every

case, which resets previewed_elements_ and resets all state tied

to the elements in Blink. As a result, when the popup calls

ClearPreviewedForm() again after filling, the operation is a no-op.

(Though clearing the form when the popup closes is legitimate if the

popup is closed while previewing something - so this should stay)



Fixed: 1478092

Change-Id: I4005cfd2fc8d46d851dc13626eb075efc4a1ccc6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4835898

Reviewed-by: Jihad Hanna

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

entry.title: Use a dynamic list of IP protection proxies
entry.content:
The primary purpose of this CL is to thread a list of proxy hostnames

through from `IpProtectionAuthTokenProvider` to the proxy delegate. This

list is cached for a long interval, but force-refreshed when proxies

fail. The result is minimal traffic to get the list during steady-state,

while allowing rapid changes to the list when necessary.



This brings a few related changes:



* `ProxyServer` gains an `is_for_ip_protection()` bit.

* `NetworkServiceProxyAllowList` provides a much simpler

`CustomProxyConfig`, which is largely ignored by the proxy

delegate when it is used for IP protection.

* Significant refactoring of `NetworkServiceProxyDelegate`.



In a followup, I will rename `IpProtectionAuthToken*` to `IpProtectionConfig*` since these classes do more than just handle auth tokens.



R=awillia@chromium.org



Bug: 1475977

entry.title: iwa: Gracefully fail requests if the `WebContents` no longer exists
entry.content:
In certain edge cases, such when the browser window is closed while a

request to an IWA is ongoing, it might not be possible to retrieve a

`WebContents` from the frame tree node id. We use the `WebContents` to

check for pending install info of an IWA. This CL fixes this by failing

with `net::ERR_FAILED` instead of crashing if the `WebContents` cannot

be retrieved.



Bug: 1477761, 1382078, b:298618746

entry.title: Add `LayoutBox::MayHaveFragmentItems`
entry.content:
When creating `NGInlineCursor` without specifying the root

fragment, it needs to scan all fragments of the specified

`LayoutBlockFlow`. This can cause O(n^2) in pre-paint, when it

invalidates `LayoutBlockFlow`, not fragments, for each

fragment.



This patch adds `LayoutBox::MayHaveFragmentItems` that can

check the existence of `NGFragmentItems` quickly without

going through all fragments.



This improves `multicol/tall-content-short-columns.html` perf

test by 185%[1].



[1] https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/17334355560000



Bug: 1473255

Change-Id: Iee7b2235e2fc843f69af06e130abfbf24a062cec

entry.title: Add Objective-C bridge for AutofillManager::Observer.
entry.content:
This CL is preparation for having the SharedPasswordController observe

the AutofillManagers of a WebState. This will enable moving the

propagation logic for Autofill server predictions to PWM to a central

location for both Chrome and WebView on iOS.



Low-coverage-reason: Tests would not be useful, it's purely bridge code.

Bug: 1466435

Change-Id: Idc7f96ab406e3c83ffa04e4b186fd959b223898e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4832432

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

entry.title: Intercept chrome.tabs API calls for extension telemetry
entry.content:
Intercept a chrome.tabs API call and forward the call details

to the extension telemetry service as a chrome.tabs API signal.

The extension telemetry service processes these signals using

the corresponding signal processor (implemented in a prior CL) so

that the data is included in telemetry reports.

entry.title: Refactor LayoutSVGShape::UpdateShapeFromElement
entry.content:
Said method currently both updates the shape data, the object bounding

box, the stroke bounds and updates the non-scaling-stroke data.

Splitting this method up allows for more targeted updates to shape

properties (like not updating the shape when the stroke changes.)



Make UpdateShapeFromElement only handle updates of shape data and the

corresponding bounds (object bounding box). Updates of stroke bounds and

non-scaling-stroke is moved out to LayoutSVGShape::UpdateLayout.



UpdateShapeFromElement is also made pure virtual on LayoutSVGShape,

making it clear that subclasses should handle this operation.

(Subclasses now always use the same way to compute the objects bounds -

regardless of whether it uses a Path or not to represent the shape.)



Merge StrokeGeometryClass and ShapeGeometryCodePath into a new

SVGShapeGeometry which is set by UpdateShapeFromElement - either

explicitly or by inspecting the actual (Path) geometry.



Bug: 493888, 709437, 1393554

Change-Id: Id7087d466076b04b70d2f54f4de9f367c425c3c8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4812740
